title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 24 September 2015 - XWiki
content:
<Denis2> has joined #xwiki  
06:03 <Denis1> has quit  
06:25 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
06:39 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
07:05 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:36 <sdumitriu> has quit  
07:40 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:56 <vmassol> has quit  
08:21 <cjd> has quit  
08:31 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:10 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
09:13 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:17 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:18 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:19 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:25 <Trefex> has quit  
09:25 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
09:54 <Ramona1> has quit  
09:55 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
09:55 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:29 <woshilapin> has quit  
10:29 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
10:48 <ldubost> has joined #xwiki  
10:59 <ldubost2> has joined #xwiki  
11:00 <ldubost> has quit  
11:00 <ldubost2> is now known as <ldubost>  
11:04 <cjd> tmortagne: thank you very much for setting up the myxwiki thing, I know I have permission on that wiki but I didn't want to say "I can take this" in the mail because I'm unsure of the process  
11:04 <tmortagne> cjd: would have been ok  
11:25 <mflorea1> has joined #xwiki  
11:28 <mflorea> has quit  
11:42 <tmortagne> guys any idea how to disable getting the page name and author in the pdf export ? I want only the content  
11:42 <tmortagne> there is no option for it in the UI  
11:45 <gdelhumeau> Not sure there is an option for it  
11:45 <tmortagne> from what I see in the code there does not seems to be any option for it  
11:46 <gdelhumeau> see: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/templates/pdfcover.vm#L12-12  
11:47 <tmortagne> that's the cover which I disabled  
11:47 <tmortagne> I disabled everything I could but remain a header with the page title and a footer with the author and date  
11:48 <tmortagne> looks like I will have to overwrite pdfheader.vm and pdffooter.vm which is a pity since it really sounds like what I need should be the default  
13:04 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
13:06 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
13:08 <Ramona1> has quit  
14:03 <vmassol1> Denis2: ping  
14:03 <vmassol1> what's that last commit? I didn't do anything :)  
14:03 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
14:04 <ldubost> has quit  
14:04 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: I think this is a mistake  
14:04 <gdelhumeau> yes I see  
14:04 <vmassol> I didn't put it in 7.2 voluntarily actually  
14:05 <vmassol> (note that at least one ci job will fail now as a consequence)  
14:05 <vmassol> (:))  
14:05 <gdelhumeau> it's reverted  
14:05 <vmassol> (we'll still get a false postivie)  
14:05 <vmassol> (just need to be aware)  
14:05 <gdelhumeau> no I can stop the build  
14:06 <vmassol> indeed  
14:06 <vmassol> better do that  
14:06 <vmassol> the problem will be in the xmlrpc func tests  
14:06 <vmassol> (if you want to stop that job)  
14:06 <gdelhumeau> It's because of my new script which performs cherry-pick  
14:06 <gdelhumeau> apparently it has failes  
14:06 <vmassol> seems this script is buggy :)  
14:06 <gdelhumeau> \*failed  
14:07 <vmassol> so, since Denis is not here I suggest you start the release  
14:08 <vmassol> we should put a warning in the 7.2 RN anyway that there's still some UI work required on ND/NS and that it'll be done in 7.3. I'll do this now  
14:08 <gdelhumeau> I've made it  
14:08 <gdelhumeau> but not very visible apparently :)  
14:08 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
14:08 <gdelhumeau> about extensions  
14:08 <vmassol> reading  
14:09 <gdelhumeau> We have worked a lot to minimize the retro-compatibility issues. However, some extensions are not adapted for Nested Pages yet, and their execution is still sub-optimal. For the next releases, we plan to work on the adaptation of these extensions.  
14:09 <gdelhumeau> not exactly about UI  
14:09 <vmassol> yes ok, I'll make it a bit more visible, thanks  
14:12 <gdelhumeau> I hesitated to put at the very top, just before Nested Pages  
14:12 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: wdyt about the new message?  
14:12 <gdelhumeau> not bad :)  
14:13 <vmassol> so the new terminology is now Nested Pages?  
14:13 <gdelhumeau> it's because you wanted to replace Document by Page  
14:13 <gdelhumeau> so I found it more logicial  
14:13 <vmassol> ok so Nested Page replaces Nested Documents  
14:13 <vmassol> but Nested Spaces is still valid  
14:13 <vmassol> got it  
14:13 <vmassol> well  
14:13 <vmassol> it's ok  
14:15 <vmassol> so  
14:15 <vmassol> back to the release  
14:16 <vmassol> I think we shuld go ahead without the security issue because  
14:16 <vmassol> 1) it's not new and we can fix it in 7.3 (or a 7.2.1 if need be)  
14:16 <vmassol> 2) we really need to release now to start progressing fast on the 7.3 release (see my roadmap email on the list and the little time we have till the end of the year)  
14:16 <vmassol> 3) we need the max feedback on 7.2  
14:17 <vmassol> wdyt?  
14:17 <gdelhumeau> It's ok to me  
14:17 <tmortagne> +1  
14:17 <vmassol> tmortagne: ok?  
14:17 <vmassol> :)  
14:17 <vmassol> thanks  
14:18 <gdelhumeau> and my patch is only an improvment that do no garrantee it fixes this issue  
14:19 <gdelhumeau> then  
14:19 <gdelhumeau> [ANN] I'm going to release 7.2, please hold your commits  
14:19 <gdelhumeau> (on that branch)  
14:20 <vmassol> hoping that your last commits didn't break anything :)  
14:22 <Denis2> well, the patch does not look harmful, the worse could be a performance degradation  
14:22 <gdelhumeau> it was a revert  
14:22 <Denis2> is now known as <Denis>  
14:22 <vmassol> still would need some full rebuild and some additional tests I think  
14:22 <vmassol> I have the feeling it might be better to work on it in 7.3  
14:23 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: to be sure, git diff e3e402fd77b3c78b47acae6f98dc1d9904aee075..HEAD returns nothing  
14:23 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: talking about your other commit  
14:23 <gdelhumeau> which one?  
14:23 <vmassol> about the more action on the right  
14:23 <vmassol> I think you just comitted something no?  
14:24 <gdelhumeau> it's on stable-7.1.x  
14:24 <vmassol> ok  
14:24 <vmassol> didn't see that  
14:24 <gdelhumeau> and stable-6.4.x  
14:24 <vmassol> k  
14:27 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: by the way you will probably be interested by the new git worktree introduced in git 2.5  
14:28 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: it does what my script does, without the bug? ^^  
14:28 <tmortagne> it allows several worktree in the same repository  
14:29 <tmortagne> kind of several clones without cloning  
14:29 <tmortagne> from what I understood it more or less several clones sharing the same git "database"  
14:29 <tmortagne> did not tried it yet but I will  
14:30 <tmortagne> in the case of xwiki-platform git history size it's a bug improvement :)  
14:31 <tmortagne> s/bug/big/  
14:31 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: just realized we don't have anymore the shortcuts to the various part of your profile in the top level menu :(  
14:32 <vmassol> so now for ex to switch the user to display hidden docs, it's one click more… was already a pain. Now it's possibly more logical as it is now, I'll think about a solution specific for the switching hidden pages. I hope there are no other important use cases as otherwise it's going to be a usability degradation  
14:33 <vmassol> we'll see if users complain  
14:33 <vmassol> it should be easy to add back some sub menu though  
14:34 <gdelhumeau> should I get the translations? I think yes  
14:34 <vmassol> oh yes definitely  
14:34 <vmassol> :)  
14:34 <vmassol> you must get them  
14:35 <gdelhumeau> it's because we can have translations related to 7.3 already  
14:35 <vmassol> sure you need to be careful about transaltions that would have been removed or deprecated in 7.3  
14:35 <vmassol> but I don'(t think there are any  
14:35 <vmassol> we really need some "affect versions" field  (ie branches) on l10n  
14:36 <gdelhumeau> I remember that you have changed the content of one  translation key recently, but I don't know if it concerns 7.2  
14:43 <gsmeria> has quit  
14:44 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: I'm  not convinced that we should plan a 7.2.1  
14:44 <vmassol> seen that we have plenty to do for NS in 7.3 I think we should release 7.3 and consider it as our stable release for NS  
14:45 <vmassol> mentioning it since I was you put XWIKI-12570 on 7.2.1  
14:45 <vmassol> wdyt?  
14:45 <vmassol> (unless we have some blockers for 7.2)  
14:46 <vmassol> ok forget what I said  
14:46 <vmassol> we can target 7.2.1 for now and decide later on if we release it or not  
14:50 <tmortagne> we should merges bugfixes like XWIKI-12570 in 7.2 branch as we always do, we will release it only if really needed as usual  
14:51 <vmassol> yep  
14:51 <vmassol> hoping we won't need to release and we can wait for 7.3  
15:14 <Denis> I have look a bit further into the security cache code, I agree that it deserver more attention, and that the patch is probably not fine as is (even if it could not harm)  
15:15 <vmassol> ok thanks Denis, I hope you'll have to the time to continue investigating in the coming days! :)  
15:15 <vmassol> thanks very much for your help!  
15:26 <Ramona1> has quit  
15:29 <msmeria> has quit  
15:52 <ldubost> has joined #xwiki  
16:17 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
16:29 <Trefex> hi all. when i create a link in Markdown 1.1 as follows:  \* [$item]($item)  
16:29 <Trefex> if the name of the page containes spaces, then the link is not created properly  
16:30 <vmassol> hi Trefex  
16:30 <Trefex> am I generating links wrong, or can a page not contain spaces?  
16:30 \* Trefex waves at vmassol  
16:30 <vmassol> yes this is know and is part of the markdown spec  
16:30 <vmassol> let me give you the link  
16:30 <vmassol> to the issue  
16:32 <vmassol> Trefex: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XRENDERING-362  
16:32 <vmassol> see also http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XRENDERING-354  
16:35 <Trefex> perfect, with [[ it works  
16:42 <ldubost> has quit  
16:52 <ldubost> has joined #xwiki  
16:58 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
17:07 <gdelhumeau> [ANN] The maven part of the release have been done. You can resume your commits on the stable-7.2.x branch  
17:25 <Trefex> hi vmassol do you know if xwiki can show some "anchor" symbol next to a header like h1, h2 on mouseover that when clicked, would copy the link to the clipboard?  
17:25 <cjd> can't but should !  
17:26 <Trefex> cjd: wohoo, i agree :D  
17:26 <cjd> how much do you agree ? :D are you a programmer ?  
17:26 <vmassol> Trefex: xwiki can do everything  
17:26 <vmassol> :)  
17:26 <vmassol> does it? Nope, not by default  
17:26 <cjd> hehe so can Lisp  
17:26 <Trefex> yes, sort of  
17:26 <vmassol> it can be added with a Javascript Skin Extension for example  
17:27 <vmassol> Trefex: you can try to code it http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/SkinExtensionsTutorial or raise a jira issue as an idea  
17:29 <Trefex> thx vmassol i check if i have the time one day to implement it  
17:29 <vmassol> k :)  
17:30 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: s/badder/worse :)  
17:30 <vmassol> "It's even badder on mobiles. " lol  
17:31 <gdelhumeau> damn of course  
17:31 <ldubost> has left #xwiki  
17:47 <OSIMasson> has quit  
17:57 <gdelhumeau> mflorea1: some doc are still mising: http://jira.xwiki.org/issues/?jql=Project%20in%20%28%22XWiki%20Commons%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Rendering%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Platform%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Enterprise%22%29%20and%20fixVersion%20in%20%28%227.2%22%29%20and%20resolution%20in%20%28%22Fixed%22%29%20and%20%28%28Documentation%20is%20EMPTY%29%20or%20%28%22Documentation%20in%20Release%20Notes%22%20is%20EMPTY%29%29  
17:58 <mflorea1> yes, I haven't forgotten, but I was busy investigating a bug.. will handle those ASAP  
17:58 <mflorea1> sorry about the delay  
18:02 <Denis> Can someone tells me if adding the URL of links in parenthesis after the links is a new feature of the print and exports done by XWiki ? Is it a feature of bootstrap ? the CSS ?  
18:03 <vmassol> no idea on my side  
18:03 <Denis> I though that it was a browser feature, but I get it on xpage=print as well  
18:04 <Denis> this is complete crap for most user IMO, and a big regression of the PDF export  
18:07 <Denis> not to say that the print preview menus and header looks really weird as well
